Others: The Lakers lost their preseason opener to the Minnesota Timberwolves by a score of 124-107.
LeBron James and Anthony Davis did not suit up for the contest.
Austin Reaves was the starter that got the most burn for Los Angeles, scoring 16 points, grabbing five rebounds, dishing seven assists, and recording a team-high three steals in 25 minutes played.
The Timberwolves' undrafted rookie Josh Minott scored 22 points while shooting 9-for-11 from the field and 4-for-6 from three, and he also tallied eight rebounds in a team-high 29 minutes.

The Lakers' top draft picks Dalton Khnect and Bronny James had strong performances, with Khnect being the leading scorer with 16 points and James recording three blocks, a team-high for the second-round rookie.
